name: Takumi Fujiwara
about: He acts as the delivery boy for his father's tofu business, driving his father's Toyota Sprinter Trueno AE86 up to the top of the mountain every morning to deliver tofu to the hotels for the day.

name: Itsuki Takeuchi
about: He provides the comic relief in the series, and is generally quite loud and obnoxious. Itsuki works part-time at a gas station with Takumi and Iketani.

name: Koichiro Iketani
about: While not a highly skilled street racer, he is likely the most skilled member of the SpeedStars, and leads the team passionately.

name: Kenji
about: He is the second-best driver in the SpeedStars and was set to race Keisuke Takahashi in Iketani's stead, though he was replaced when the Eight-Six arrived at the last minute.

name: Keisuke Takahashi
about: An ex-bosozoku gang member, he was introduced to street racing by his brother Ryosuke and joined his team, the Akagi RedSuns, and soon became their second best driver in his Mazda RX-7 Type R (FD3S).

name: Ryosuke Takahashi
about: He is the founder, and leader of both the Akagi RedSuns and Project D. Famously nicknamed Akagi's White Comet, Ryosuke created the RedSuns with the purpose of dominating the street racing scene all over Japan.

name: Bunta Fujiwara
about: He is the owner of a tofu shop in Gunma, and the father of Takumi. He used to be the fastest downhill racer on Akina years ago, but he no longer races, preferring to guide Takumi's racing development.

name: Yuichi Tachibana
about: He is the owner of the gas station that Takumi Fujiwara and his friends worked in. An old friend of Bunta Fujiwara's and a racer in his youth, Yuichi acts like a father figure to the Akina SpeedStars.

name: Natsuki Mogi
about: She is Takumi Fujiwara's love interest during the Akina's Eight-Six Arc. She's one of the few people to not be terrified by Takumi's racing.

name: Mika Uehara
about: She is Takumi Fujiwara's love interest during the Kanagawa Expedition Arc. She is also an experienced golfer, and aspires to become a professional.

name: Mako Sato
about: She is the driver of Impact Blue, consisting of her and her co-pilot and best friend Sayuki.

name: Sayuki
about: She is the navigator for Impact Blue. She acts as a co-pilot for Mako Sato, and works with her in her battle against Takumi Fujiwara in First Stage. Sayuki is a cheerful, outgoing girl always looking for good looking men.

name: Takeshi Nakazato
about: He is the leader of the Myogi NightKids. He made his first appearance at the race in Akina where Keisuke Takahashi of the RedSuns is to race against Takumi Fujiwara.

name: Shingo Shoji
about: is a member of the Myogi NightKids who drives a red Honda Civic SiR-II (EG6). Shingo races dangerously; he will nudge his rival's car in order to make the other driver lose control if he's unsure about his own chances of winning.

name: Wataru Akiyama
about: Wataru Akiyama is a street racer from Saitama Prefecture.

name: Kazumi Akiyama
about: She is Wataru Akiyama's younger sister and Itsuki Takeuchi's first love interest

name: Nobuhiko Akiyama
about: He is the leader of the Northern Saitama Alliance and Wataru Akiyama's cousin.

name: Kenta Nakamura
about: He absolutely adores Keisuke Takahashi and is always eager to prove himself to Keisuke. Kenta was recognized by Keisuke himself for his driving skills, and has been somewhat taken under his wing.

name: Fumihiro
about: He serves as Project D's second in command and handler, setting up and organizing battles with other teams, as well as scouting out prospective courses.

name: Kyoichi Sudo
about: He is the leader of Emperor. Like the rest of the team, he drives a Mitsubishi Lancer Evolution. He has a long time rivalry with Ryosuke Takahashi.

name: Seiji Iwaki
about: He is the number two driver in the Lancer Evolution-only Emperor team, driving a Lancer Evolution IV. Seiji is a driver with good racing skills, but he is rather arrogant and occasionally imprudent.

name: Saori
about: She is an anime-only character who appeared only in First Stage. She is a friend of Natsuki Mogi, as well as the brief love interest of Itsuki Takeuchi.

name: Kyoko Iwase
about: She is the fastest member and uphill representative of an unnamed Sadamine based team, and later a member of the Northern Saitama Alliance.

name: Shuichi Matsumoto
about: He is a member of Project D's support staff, and the designated mechanic for Takumi Fujiwara and his Toyota AE86.

name: Masashi Suzuki
about: He has great connections enabling him to get exceptional parts, including the engine that he and Bunta installed in the AE86: a TRD tuned Group A Silvertop 20V 4A-GE. After handing down the Trueno to Takumi.

name: Toshiya Joshima
about: He is one of the top members of the Tsukuba based team Purple Shadow, alongside Kozo Hoshino.

name: Kozo Hoshino
about: He affectionately called Ko-cha, is one of the best members of Tsukuba based team Purple Shadow, alongside Dr. Toshiya Joshima.

name: Rin Hojo
about: He is the infamous Grim Reaper of Kanagawa and Go Hojo's elder brother.

name: Ryuji Ikeda
about: He is the leader of Team Spiral and referred to as Zero. Ikeda's family staff a temple - moreover, his father is the temple's head priest and as a result has ample funds to finance his racing career.

name: Go Hojo
about: He is the leader of Sidewinder, and the team's uphill driver. Alongside Eiji Kubo, he organised Kanagawa's four lines of defence, four teams intent on beating Project D

name: Kaori
about: She was Ryosuke Takahashi's love interest and the arranged fiancé of Rin Hojo, before her untimely death.

name: Kai Kogashiwa
about: He is a street racer from Tochigi prefecture, and the son of Ken Kogashiwa. He was a go-kart driver in his youth, later having a brief stint as a street racer before becoming a professional racer and joining Katagiri.

name: Ken Kogashiwa
about: He is Kai's father and Bunta Fujiwara's lifelong rival. Ken was defeated multiple times by Bunta, and it still seems to be a sore spot for him.

name: Daiki Ninomiya
about: He is a student of the Todo School, and their downhill representative in their battles with Project D.

name: Satoshi Omiya
about: He is Team 246's leader and downhill representative.

name: Sakamoto
about: He is a professional rally driver, who was recruited by the Northern Saitama Alliance to race for them in their battles with Project D.

name: Toru Suetsugu
about: He is the downhill racer of the Momiji Line based team Seven Star Leaf. He is known for his reckless, kamikaze downhill style.

name: Tomoyuki Tachi
about: He is a professional racer and a graduate, or "old boy" (shortened to OB) of the Todo School.

name: Todo
about: He is an ex-professional rally driver and the leader of the Todo School.

name: Keiichi Tsuchiya
about: He is a professional Japanese racing driver. He is known as the Drift King (ドリキン, Dorikin) for his use of drifting in non-drifting racing events. He popularized drifting in Motorsport in the 80s and 90s, and is also known for tōge (mountain pass) racing.
